title: End of Month Check
body: First month with fish complete! Nitrate at 17 ppm. Everyone is healthy and eating well. Very proud of this tank.

title: Feeding
body: Fed: flakes + bloodworms. Tetras are getting more comfortable, schooling tighter now.

title: Weekly Maintenance
body: Water change 25%. Dosed NilocG Thrive Plus 2 pumps (starting with lower dose). Fish seem happy.

title: Two Week Check
body: Two weeks with fish! Nitrate at 15 ppm. Parameters holding steady. This is going well.

title: Feeding
body: Fed: algae wafers + flakes. Cory cats found the wafers immediately, they're settling in nicely.

title: Weekly Water Change
body: Water change 20% (going gentle since fish are new). Everyone looking healthy, no stress signs.

title: One Week With Fish
body: One week since adding fish! Nitrate at 12 ppm. Everyone eating well, no losses. Feeling confident.

title: Feeding
body: Fed: flakes + brine shrimp. Fish are starting to recognize feeding time, swimming to the top eagerly.

title: Added Cory Cats
body: Added 4 panda cory catfish today! Drip acclimated for 45 minutes. They're exploring the bottom already.

title: First Parameters After Fish
body: First test with fish in tank. Nitrate at 8 ppm. Ammonia 0, Nitrite 0. Cycle is holding strong!

title: Day After Fish
body: Fed: flakes. Everyone ate! Tetras are a bit shy but that's normal. Watching parameters closely.

title: First Feeding
body: Fed: flakes only for first feeding. Small amount to be cautious. 4 out of 6 tetras ate, the others are still nervous.

title: Tank Cycling Complete - Fish Added!
body: Cycling complete after 5 weeks! Ammonia 0, Nitrite 0, Nitrate at 10 ppm. Added first fish today - 6 neon tetras. Drip acclimated for 30 minutes. Everyone looks healthy and is exploring the tank. This is so exciting!

title: Final Cycle Check
body: Ammonia 0, Nitrite 0, Nitrate 8 ppm. Cycle is stable! Adding fish tomorrow. Prepared quarantine supplies just in case.

title: Cycle Almost Done
body: Added 2ppm ammonia yesterday, tested today - ammonia 0, nitrite 0.25, nitrate 5ppm. Almost there!
